pull.title: build: Restore compatibility with older boost
pull.body:
In light of #14979, I realized that only qt 5.5+ was being tested under CI, while compatibility lists 5.2+.

In #15276, Marco added Trusty to CI, building with depends. This changes that build to system libraries, in order to ensure ongoing compatibility with our claimed minimum required versions.

Fixes #14983, previously open as #14998

rename.from: ci: Build and test Trusty against system libraries, fix incompatibilities
rename.to: travis: Build and test Trusty against system libraries, fix incompatibilities

tree f475976fb2608b46a372e6e5b71e0cf9edc17c9c
parent 1971f5ba04de9ac1e1a95d9f727e7bd4bc35dc88
author Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1548960383 -0800
committer Ben Woosley <ben.woosley@gmail.com> 1549001455 -0800

Prefer boost::optional#get_value_or over #value_or

The latter is not defined in the earliest supported version of boost,
1.47.
https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_47_0/libs/optional/doc/html/boost_optional/detailed_semantics.html
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/486674823

events.message: travis: Document whether functional tests are run in the job name

events.body: Set out to prove that each commit was necessary and realized instead that I could drop several of them thanks to functional tests being disabled (unlike in #14998). As you can see, the commits that remain correct incompatibilities with the earlier Boost version, 1.47.

rename.from: travis: Build and test Trusty against system libraries, fix incompatibilities
rename.to: build: Restore compatibility with older boost

events.body: ACK. Could do the value_or replacement as scripted diff?

Concept ACK and 119d360 still builds fine for me on macOS.

Maybe @ryanofsky  can sanity check the `CMainSignals::RegisterWithMempoolSignals(` change.

issue.title: [Do Not Merge] break < Qt5.6 compatibility for addAction to test Travis
issue.body:
This reverts commit 3e21b690d1aedb73a7dc2bc5d2ff1b011b52d927 from #14979.

#15308 should catch this
